column4: anybody know how i can access a website on my HD using IE on crossover office? without apache..
if it's just a html file, you can simply go to the place
and how do i do that?
it's not like i can enter /home/... in my address bar in IE
but I don't know what crossover office does exactly
no, you can't do that in IE under crossover
firefox runs under linux natively. big difference

well, since Crossover is based off of Wine (isn't it) I guess it uses /home/user/.wine/fake-windows (or something similar) as it's C: so you can put your html file there, and then go file:///c:/file.html with IE
i just told you file:/// doesn't work
well, then it doesn't. Can't help you, sorry.
the fake HD is located at /home/user/.cxoffice/dotwine/dosdevices/c: but i can't get IE to access it
it's paid, so they'd better help you ;-)
